headline.main: How Much Does Health Care Cost You?

docs.abstract: If your household is typical, it costs about $15,000.
docs.snippet: If your household is typical, it costs about $15,000.

docs.lead_paragraph: For progressives who now want universal health insurance, Medicare may have been a mistake -- tactically, anyway.

headline.main: Maybe Medicare Was a Tactical Error

docs.abstract: At least for progressives who now want universal health insurance.
docs.snippet: At least for progressives who now want universal health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Drug makers, advocacy groups, biotechnology firms and insurance companies have ratcheted up efforts to offer their two cents-and in most cases much, much more-in influencing the health care legislation now working its way through Congress.

headline.main: Lobbying Increases as Health Care Debate Intensifies

docs.abstract: Drug makers, advocacy groups, biotechnology firms and insurance companies have ratcheted up efforts to offer their two cents-and in most cases much, much more-in influencing health care legislation.
docs.snippet: Drug makers, advocacy groups, biotechnology firms and insurance companies have ratcheted up efforts to offer their two cents-and in most cases much, much more-in influencing health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama's appearance in the Rose Garden on Tuesday marked the latest step of an aggressive strategy by the White House to keep the health care debate at the forefront of public attention.

headline.main: Obama Renews Push for Health Care Reform
headline.sub: The President Urges Congress Not to Delay Action

docs.snippet: President Obama's appearance in the Rose Garden on Tuesday marked the latest step of an aggressive strategy by the White House to keep the health care debate at the forefront of public attention.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama should not expect the support of the United States Chamber of Commerce as he encourages industry leaders to sign onto his health care plans. The organization announced Tuesday it that is beginning a series of ads tomorrow to oppose health care proposals that include a public plan.

headline.main: Chamber Starts Ad Campaign Against Obama on Health Care

docs.abstract: The business organization sponsors a multimillion-dollar advertising campaign against any measure that would include a public plan.
docs.snippet: The business organization sponsors a multimillion-dollar advertising campaign against any measure that would include a public plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama on Tuesday strived to keep the landmark health care debate on track as he sought to diminish the differences and focus on "extraordinary common ground" among the competing legislative plans. He urged Congress not to delay action, declaring: "We are closer than ever before to the reform American people need."

headline.main: Obama Keeps the Pressure On Health Care Bills

docs.abstract: The president also met privately with members of the House Energy and Commerce Committee, which has yet to pass its own health bill.
docs.snippet: The president also met privately with members of the House Energy and Commerce Committee, which has yet to pass its own health bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Kathryn Zerbe, professor of psychiatry at Oregon Health and Science University and a longtime expert on eating disorders, recently took readers' questions on anorexia, bulimia, binge eating and related problems. Here, she responds to various questions on treatment of eating disorders, how to pay for therapy, and whether conditions like anorexia and bulimia can be cured.
docs.abstract: Dr. Kathryn Zerbe offers expert advice on the treatment of anorexia, bulimia, binge eating and other eating disorders.
docs.snippet: Dr. Kathryn Zerbe offers expert advice on the treatment of anorexia, bulimia, binge eating and other eating disorders.

docs.lead_paragraph: Biotechnology and medical device start-ups typically take many years and a lot of money to get to market. But Chrysalis Ventures, a venture capital firm in Louisville, Ky., takes a different approach to health care investments.

headline.main: Betting on Health Care Start-Ups That Cut Costs

docs.abstract: Chrysalis Ventures invests in start-ups that aim to make health care more productive, cost-effective and accessible to patients.
docs.snippet: Chrysalis Ventures invests in start-ups that aim to make health care more productive, cost-effective and accessible to patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: It once seemed as if President Obama would lead a center-left coalition, but instead, he has deferred to the Old Bulls on Capitol Hill on issue after issue.
docs.snippet: It once seemed as if President Obama would lead a center-left coalition, but instead, he has deferred to the Old Bulls on Capitol Hill on issue after issue.

docs.lead_paragraph: California lawmakers finally sealed a deal with the governor on a plan to close a $26 billion budget gap.

headline.main: California Reaches Budget Deal, With Billions Cut
headline.print_headline: Budget Deal Sealed at Last In California; Billions Cut

docs.snippet: California lawmakers finally sealed a deal with the governor on a plan to close a $26 billion budget gap.
